explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: No data available by regulated examination methods, though "Flammable" (ICSC (J) (2002))

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no oxygen , chlorine and fluorine.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on Rat LD50 values: 8600mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001, NTP TR 166, 1979), 1300mg/kg, 2500mg/kg, and 3100mg/kg (DFGOT vol.5, 1993). Since the calculated value was 2244mg/kg, it was set as Category 5.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit LD50 value: >2000mg/kg (IUCLID, 2000, HSDB, 2006), it was set as the outside of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In the test applied to the skin of the rabbit of DFGOT (vol.5, 1993), slight erythema was admitted, but it disappeared 6 hours afterward. Acceptance criteria of irritation was not suited and it was carried out the outside of Category.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description that mild irritation was acknowledged in the test applied to the eye of the rabbit (IUCLID (2000)), it was set as Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: Although it is classified to be Sh (MAK/BAT, 2004) according to DFG, there was no evidence which suggests that skin contacts induce hypersensitivity in humans, therefore it was presupposed that we cannot classify it because of the insufficiency of the data.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there is a negative result with the micronucleus test, an in vivo mutagenicity test with somatic cell on mouse marrow cells (IUCLID, 2000), it is considered to be out of Category. However, there is only data of in vitro examination with the source of Priority 1, and it could not negate toxicity clearly. So it was presupposed that it cannot be classified due to data insufficiency.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was classified into a group 3 (IARC Suppl.7 1987) in IARC and was classified into A4 (ACGIH 7th, 2001) in ACGIH. So it was considered as the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is a description that malformations (two cases) or abortion (one case) was observed in five pregnant women exposed in early pregnancy (DFGOT (vol. 5, 1993)). In addition, there is a description that functional disorders of female genitalia are caused by occupational exposure. However, since it was not a sufficient evidence to be considered as Category 1A, it was classified into Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In DFGOT (vol.5, 1993), from description that as for the children ingested large amount orally was acknowleged pupillary dilation, uneasy and depression, and headaches and locomotor ataxias were acknowledged to adults. It judged that a nervous systems was affected and was set as Category 1 (nervous system).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, liver, thyroid gland, endocrine system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, liver, thyroid gland, endocrine system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on descriptions that a polyneuropathy and etc. are acknowledged as side effects at the time of taking in as a drug of ACGIH (7th, 2001), that In the example of long-term oral ingestion of DFGOT (vol.5, 1993), mood disorders, liver damage and change of the hormone concentration in blood etc. were acknowledged, and that hyperplasia of the thyroid gland accompanied by iodine uptake decreases was observed with the given dose of the guidance value range of Category 1 in the oral study using the rat of DFGOT (vol.5, 1993), it was classified into Category 1 (nervous systems, liver, the thyroid gland, endocrine system).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour LC50=120microg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, and supposed not rapidly degrading (estimated by the decomposition rate of tetraethylthiuram disulfide by BOD: 2.8% (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=3.88 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
